channel.title: Posts on Sudarshana A
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Sudarshana A

item.title: MINETEST Game
item.description: Minetest is similar to Minecraft. I want to install Minecarft for Linux and did some research. Accidentally I found out about the Minetest, an open source game similar to Minecraft. I have installed it to my laptop running Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS. Tutorial for Minetest beginers can be found here.

item.title: GitHub changes - user name
item.description: I have changed my GitHub user name to more meaningful name. ðŸ˜ƒ What happens when I change my username? Also spent some time to clean up my GitHub account and set up all the remote links to the repositories. First I have listed my existing remotes to get the names e.g. go to the local repository folder and run the command git remote -v $ git remote -v origin https://github.

item.title: New Personal Blog using Blogdown
item.description: Past few days I was busy with DataCamp lessons and not much time for write something new. I have transfred by previous blog entries(SnD Creations) to new repository and used blogdown with beautifulhugo theme. Several Hugo themes have been used beofre selecting beautifulhugo theme. I want somehting similar to bootstrap with fixed navigation bar, plus support for Math. Thanks to blogdown book from Yihui Xie, finally I have re-launched the site using blogdown & Hugo.

item.title: Keyboard Backlight - Dell - Ubuntu
item.description: I have realised my Dell laptop keyborad backlight doesn’t light up in Ubuntu. So did some browsing and changed the config file. Set the brightness level to > 0 using below, you need to change the value using super user (or root). Open the config using nano editor. sudo nano /sys/devices/platform/dell-laptop/leds/dell\:\:kbd_backlight/brightness change the value 0, I have changed it to 2, then save the config. Also if required we can set the timeout of the keyboard backlight.

item.title: Installed CherryTree
item.description: To day I have installed CherryTree. Nice note taking application. You can download CheeryTree from here.

item.title: Set up local copy of site
item.description: To day I have installed a local copy of this web site. Using Jekyll. I have refered Setting up your GitHub Pages site locally with Jekyll for that. As per the instruction below command used for check the Ruby version. ruby --version I had to installed Ruby, then bundler but after completting most of the items, an error message popped up in the terminal. Failed to build gem native extension…

item.title: Simple Probability with R programming project
item.description: Add more functinality to my simple probability R markdown files. Used dplyr and tidyr packages to arrange data. But later I have changed the code so that most of the data was arranged using base R.

item.title: Installed Ubuntu 17.10
item.description: To day I have installed Ubuntu 17.10 on new laptop. Also installed RStudio, Git and tried Scratch, but Scratch is an old version so uninstalled that.

item.title: Tried Ubuntu 17.10
item.description: To day I have tried Ubuntu 17.10 on new laptop. Previously tried the Ubuntu 16.04. Seems fine to install it along side with Win7. I bought new (actually it is not new, bought it 2nd hand laptop via ebay.) laptop. It supposed to come without OS but new copy of OEM windows 7 already there. ðŸ˜ƒ

item.title: Learning and Testing GIT
item.description: Today I played around with GitHub and installed Git for windows. Changed my commit email and used noreply email generated by GitHub. GIT Bash Also used Git Bash..

item.title: SnD Creations, Launches Site
item.description: Well. Finally got around to putting this. Neat thing about it - powered by Jekyll and I can use Markdown to author my posts. It actually is a lot easier than I thought it was going to be.
